author: nc1234
content: I think some mechanism to indicate when a soon-to-be-deprecated endpoint is "safe to remove" from clients' codebase, or some sort of "available til x hardfork"  would be nice

author: .paulharris
content: typically it'd be 'deprecated' and we'd delete it after a couple of hard forks but ad-hoc... i'm happy with deprecated, just would be nice to have a firm idea of when its 'safe' to remove i guess

author: jgm
content: Yeah would be a good idea to add a note as to in which hard fork each deprecated call can be removed.

author: .paulharris
content: we could put 'deprecated in XX, can be removed in YY' in description... could alternatively (or also) have an entry in changes log. Would need to be remembered i guess
